title: Presentation of the Portuguese market links with Brazil, Angola and Mozambique

author: Ana Isabel Franco de Sousa Douglas, AICEP Portugal Global - Trade & Investment Agency

segmentation: Hello, good afternoon.
My name is only Isabelle Douglas to make it more simple.
I am representing the counterpart of Chapte which is Icep Portugal global.
Responsible for the same as chapter is we are responsive.
For responsible for promoting the Portuguese experts all over the world and the Foreign direct investment in Portugal as well as the Foreign direct investment from Portugal abroad.
We are here and I think that Mr Place in Yackandandah Tonya drop Nick already said a lot which I will not repeat because we are like twin countries in the EU.
One at one hand one and then the other one.
At the other hand, so we can profit both of us from our geographical location, opening doors to 3rd markets outside our common market, and that's what we're doing here today.
So.
We are responsible for the promotion, promotion of investment and exports.
Of course we can also help in intermediate products that can be exported elsewhere.
And the question why Portugal?
I think it was already answered.

Because talking about Brazil, Angola, Mozambique, Vinay, Arviso, Cafard, Portugal is the pre destinated partner because of traditional cultural, economic and social ties we have with those countries since the 15th century.
And we are doing quite well in those markets.
What you go ahead is strategically located.
And the.
Oh, what ties with Africa and Latin America?
Open doors to a consumer market of 220 million people?
Which is?
A bit in our small economies and can make the difference in the future.
Portugal is also characterized by a very skilled workforce on the academic level and also on the technical level.
We
I'm not lazy.
We don't strike too much.
We didn't until now.
The crisis in Portugal is changing things a little bit, but let's these difficult.
Go over and I'm sure that the Portuguese citizens will cope with the situation because we are like, the Austin says, the humble man.
We always stand up again.
We have done that in the in the past and we will do that in the future.
The labor costs are very competitive in Portugal.
Uh, we have a level of digitalization which is really in the upper level in Europe.
Telecommunications system wide spreads.
And Portugal is also a case study in questions of the government for the United Nations.
And also for the.
Simplification of business procedures.
We have a system which is implemented since quite a few years which is called simplex.
Like the name says, we try to make the creation of a business very simple.
You can create a company in one within one hour online.
No problem.
You have no problems with licensing you have.
I would say multilingual community in Portugal.
So no problems with with languages when the Portuguese people cannot understand you.
They speak with hands and feet and you understand them.
That's maybe one of the reasons why foreign skilled people working in Portugal.
Usually would like to stay and not to leave when the term is over.
We also have a beautiful landscape.
We have the sun, the scent, the Gulf of the sports and a fantastic landscapes which are very appreciated.
We have a very good gastronomy and the foreigners usually we have a nice wine usually like and enjoy all these extra benefits they get when living in Portugal.
By the way.
By improving the delivery of public services, Portugal was ranked rank one by the United Nations in May 2011.
That's something we are small.
We are fine.
We have our mistakes as everybody, but we do our best and sometimes we cope.
What's your goal?
Has a very high developed infrastructure in all four transportation ways we have 5 seaports main supports in the continent in the mainland, plus in assorted San Madera.
A deep sea port in scenes and that goes to Luca Copper.
We are intending to bring you together.
Let's hope that someday it will.
Come to a reality.
We have a very well developed railway system in Portugal with four international rail lines exiting Portugal in all directions.
We have a roadway which is maybe even more than we need, but it's perfect.
We are open a very open community always if you see Portugal was in the times of the discoveries in the fifteen 16th century.
Maybe the only nation who mixed with the local populations of the countries.
They got into.
And so we kept friends from them from then until now, with some inbetweens today, the relationship between Portugal and the former Portuguese.
Let's say empire countries are of best friendship and collaboration.
So altogether we represent a 250 million consumer markets.
Plus EU 500 million people.
I think if Slovenia would like to take advantage of these advantages and Portugal would take advantage of the.
Ties that Slovenia has with southeastern Europe.
We could develop a huge market with huge opportunities for all of us, and that's the idea of this seminar, and I hope it's only a first step and many, many others will follow.
Now let's go a bit more into detail, and starting with Angola.
Angola became independent after the Portuguese, so called Rift Pacific Revolution of 75, nineteen 75.
Angola is nowadays the fourth commercial partner for Portugal.
With the growth of 10% between 2007 in 2011.
Almost 8000 Portuguese companies are exporting to Angola.
And, uh, Portugal invested a lot in that country, almost 700 million 2010.
And a bit less than half of that in 2011 due to the economic crisis.
But the numbers are raising again.
Thank God and maybe the future will bring us.
A better performance in both ways.
In this slide you see some of the very important companies and groups that are acting an operating in Angola in the most different sectors.
For instance, Lina Teixeira Duarte and Martin Gill are the three main Portuguese construction companies.
Galpin Energy PT is the Portuguese Telamon telecommunication company.
Small in the soft drink industry.
If Assec invisibe to in the renewables and metal processing industry and construction so nice.
One of the biggest groups in distribution.
Primavera software novabus so so for Matic solutions.
Well we have all over the spectrum of economy Portuguese companies working in the implemented in Angola.
Also banks and insurances and other services consulting which could be a very good supporting hand for slipping companies that want to approach that markets.
We have a very good experience.
We know the mentality.
We know the tradition, the users and the language which are various that mostly are difficult for foreigners.
To overpass when introducing themselves to the markets.
Brazil is of course a huge.
Economy belonging now to the Big 5 in the world.
Is the tense commercial partial partner of Portugal with an increasing growing rate of 25% in the last three four years?
And the six client of Portuguese exports in services.
Portugal invested 1 billion euros in 2010 and only the half in 2011.
The numbers again, are raising in the 2012 and Brazil also is starting to invest in a very mighty way in Portugal.

In the last years two big plans for composite products for the construction of planes from Embraer where settled in in Portugal, in Avra in agriculture region which is now industrializing and I was there.
Two weeks ago, and I must tell you, it's quite impressive they are building the all the parts for the substitute of the plane, Hercules, which is the Embraer counterpart.
I don't remember the name C have 130 I think is it which will go to Brazil to be assembled there and then exported all over the world.
Um?

We have again lots of companies from the tourist sector segments, software, plastic, industry, energy and whatever invested in molds, for instance, which is a very important industry in Portugal, Portugal is.
Considered one of the best performers in the mold industry for plastic injection and for metals.
This is something that maybe it would be useful here also in Slovenia because of the plastic industry, we have some gardenia and some other coffee, no plastic and others.
We have the automotive industry which is again the main position in our exports and important both sides.
As far as I know.
Portugal and Mozambique in Mozambique.
From all those three markets that we are considering in this small presentation, Mozambique is maybe the fastest growing at the moment.
There are lots of opportunities, yes.
We see a big big movement and the increasing economic activity not only from Portuguese companies in Mozambique, but from all over the world.
South Africa is also improving, as you know, in Brazil in the Mozambique is neighbor country and working very tight together with South Africa.
They're both profiting from the development of both sides and cooperating alot.
Again, we have.
The the Portuguese companies invested in in a in a Mozambique Porto sale in the paper industry.
So as the cost includes construction be all in the in the pharmaceutic industry which is I think operating with cricket for instance.
And the of course, the construction industry.
Portugal has a summer funds.
To support the economic activity of Portuguese companies in the Portuguese speaking countries in Africa.
Where of course partners.
Foreign partners that want to go to those markets together with Portuguese companies also would benefit.
Of this funding and capital is called so feed, which is the EDFI European development financial institutions is the Portuguese member of the DFI.
Providing financial and consulting services which you also can find among Portuguese possible partners for to develop your business.
Uh.
And Portugal, Portugal.
You have a big support from the Portuguese government to activities in the.
Portuguese speaking countries in Africa and, in Brazil because since Portugal is a small country in the very end of Europe in the West End of Europe.
We only can develop through the sea because our dear brothers in Spain don't allow us to, so they are.
We have very good tights.
We we with SPF we are very good neighbors, but expanding more than we did until now.
Is quite difficult, so we are and Spanish.
The economy is not growing that much.
We have to do to search for growing economies and the answer is.
Africa and South America.
And that would be all for the moment if.
You see any?
Interesting.
Part of this presentation that can provide some questions we can answer at the end of these seminar.
We will be glad to assist you.
Thank you so much.
Thank you so much Isabel.
For this inspiring presentation.
Thank you.
